intro: Navarretia brevicula, commonly known as the dwarf navarretia, is a small flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its delicate, low-growing habit and produces clusters of tiny, white, star-shaped flowers. The plant typically blooms in early spring, often in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or rocky areas. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is known for its rapid life cycle, completing its growth and reproduction within a single growing season. Navarretia brevicula is also noted for its ability to thrive in nutrient-poor soils and its role in supporting local pollinator populations.
